sarva-jāta-pārihārika, cf. Prakrit sava-jāta-pārihārika (Select
Inscriptions, pp. 92, 94), ‘endowed with all kinds of exemptions.’
text.7081:
sarva-paṅga-parihṛta (EI 33), ‘free from all levies falling
in the category of paṅga’. See paṅga noticed above.
text.7082:
sarva-parihāra-kārudeya (EI 24), refers to all kinds of
exemptions including the dues from artisans.
text.7086:
sarva-rājakīyānām = a-hasta-prakṣepaṇīyaḥ (CII 3), same as
a-bhaṭa-praveśa, a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-prāveśya, a-bhaṭa-cchātra-prāveśya, etc.
text.7087:
sarva-vādhā-vivarjita, with vādhā in the place of bādhā; same
as parihṛta-sarva-pīḍa, sarva-pīḍā-varjita, etc. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 401.
text.7088:
sarva-viṣṭi-parihāra-parihṛta (EI 23, 24, 26), ‘endowed with
the exemptions from all kinds of unpaid labour’;
epithet of
the gift village.
text.7089:
sarv-āya-sahita (Ind. Ant., Vol. XIX, p. 247, text line 203),
‘together with the entire income.’
text.7092:
sarv-oparikar-ādāna-sahita, ‘together with the right to levy
all minor taxes or taxes on temporary tenants’;
epithet of gift
village. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 401.
text.7093:
sarv-oparikara-kar-ādāna-sameta (EI 23), ‘together with
all the levies falling in the categories of uparikara and kara’.
See kara and uparikara as noticed above.
text.7094:
sarv-otpatti-sahita (EI 23), ‘together with whatever is
produced (i. e. crops or income).’
text.7095:
sarv-eṣṭi-parihāra-parihṛta (EI 27), sarv-eṣṭi may be a
mistake for sarva-viṣṭi.
text.7096:
sa-saibara (EI 17), also written sa-śaivara; ‘together with
unassessed arable lands or the tax on farm-houses’;
cf. śaivara
and saibara noticed above.
text.7097:
sa-sarva-pallika (Ep. Ind., Vol. XXXV, p. 129), ‘together
with all the hamlets’.
text.7098:
sa-sarv-āśan-ekṣu-karpāsa-śaṇ-āmra-madhūk-ādi-bhūruha, ‘to
gether with aśana (pītaśāla), sugarcane, cotton-plants, hemp
plants, mango, madhūka and other trees’;
epithet of gift land.
Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 395.
text.7099:
sa-sāṭa-viṭapa (EI 12), mistake or wrong reading of sa-
jhāṭa-viṭapa (q. v.).
text.7100:
s-āṣṭādaśa-prakṛty = opeta (EI 2), ‘together with the
eighteen (i. e. all) kinds of tenants (i. e. tenants belonging
to all the communities)’.
text.7101:
sa-sthāvara-jaṅgama, ‘together with the immovable and
movable belongings [of the gift village]’. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 395.
text.7102:
sa-tala (EI 12, 29), ‘together with the surface of the
ground’.
text.7103:
sa-tālaka (EI 12), ‘together with palmyra palms’;
epi
thet of gift village.
text.7105:
sa-tantuvāya-gokuṭa-śauṇḍik-ādi-prakṛtika, ‘together with such
tenants as the weavers, cowherds or milkmen and vintners’;
epithet of gift village. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 393.
text.7108:
sa-tṛṇa-kāṣṭh-odak-opeta (EI 24), ‘together with the grass,
fuel and waters [of the gift village]’.
text.7109:
sa-vanaspaty-udak-āsīhāra-kullaka-pānīya-sameta ‘together with
the fruit-trees and various kinds of water courses’;
epithet of
gift land. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 394.
text.7110:
sa-vana-śvabhra-nidhāna, ‘together with forests, pits and
mines’;
epithet of gift village. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 395.
text.7113:
sa-viṭap-āraṇya, ‘together with bushes and jungles’;
epithet of gift village.
text.7114:
sa-vṛkṣamālā-kula (EI 23;
IA 11), ‘together with vari
ous gardens or plantations’. See nānā-vṛkṣa-sameta.
text.7116:
sīm-āntargata-vastu-sahita, ‘together with [all] things with
in the boundaries’;
cf. Ind. Ep., p. 395.
text.7117:
sīsū-madhūka-tāla-prabhṛti-nānā-vṛkṣa-sameta, refers to the
right to use various trees in the gift village without the king's
permission which was necessary for the ordinary tenants. See
nānā-vṛkṣa-sameta, etc. Cf. Ind. Ep. p. 401.
text.7118:
s-oddeśa (EI 12, 29), ‘together with the space above the
surface of the ground’;
epithet of gift land.
text.7119:
s-odraṅga (EI 12, 27, 29), ‘together with the tax called
udraṅga’. Udraṅga is = uddhāra, Tamil uttāra, fixed taxes.
text.7120:
s-opajāt-ānya-vastuka (EI 26), ‘together with all the
articles that may be produced [in the gift land] other than
those mentioned.’
text.7121:
s-opanidhi (EI 12, 27), refers to the freedom of the donee
of the gift land from the obligation of surrendering to the king
any valuables found on it;
cf. niṣepa in sa-nidhi-nikṣepa.
text.7122:
s-oparikara (EI 12, 27, 29), sometimes quoted as sa-pari-
kara; ‘together with minor taxes or taxes realisable from tem
porary tenants’;
epithet of gift village.
text.7123:
s-oparikara-daṇḍa (EI 27), ‘together with minor taxes
(or the tax on temporary tenants) and fines.’
text.7125:
s-ordhv-ādhaś = catur-āghāṭa viśuddha (EI 24), see s-ordhv-
ādhaḥ and catur-āghāṭa-viśuddha. Āghāṭa is often written āghāṭana.
text.7126:
s-oṣara (Ep. Ind., Vol. XXXV, p. 135), ‘together with
barren lands (or saline spots)’.
text.7127:
s-oṣar-āvaskara-sthāna-nivāta-lavaṇ-ākara (EI 22), see the
various words as noticed above. Nivāta = āvāta.
text.7129:
s-otpadhyamāna-viṣṭika (EI 23, IA 11), ‘together with the
right to get unpaid labour whenever that may be due from the
tenants’;
epithet of gift land.
text.7131:
śulka-daṇḍa-dāṇa -kāruka-maulika-śrotra-nidhi-nikṣepa-jala-
paṣāṇa-tejaḥ-svāmyam = ity-ādy-aṣṭa-bhoga-sahitam, ‘together with
right to the enjoyment of the gift land in eight ways such as
the rights to tolls, fines (or obligations), customs duties, taxes
on artisans, fixed revenue, rent of public buildings, treasure
trove, occasional finds or deposits, fishing, quarrying and tejaḥ-
svāmya (full authority arising out of ownership).’ See the various
words as noticed above. Cf. Ind. Ep., Vol. XXXII, p. 42.
text.7132:
su-pallik-āpeta (Ep. Ind., Vol. XXXV, p. 139), same as
sa-pallika.
text.7133:
suvarṇadaṇḍa-ahidaṇḍa -vartmadaṇḍa-vandāpanā-vijayandāpanā-
tṛṇodaka-śāsanārdhika-cara(vara ?)balīvarad-ārthāruvā-pratyarthāruvā-
padātijīvya-ādattā-āturāvaḍḍi-bhaviṣyat-kar-ādi-sahita, refers to the
right of the donee to levy various taxes, the nature of some of
which is uncertain (see the different expressions as noticed above).
These include tax on the goldsmiths and snake-charmers, tolls to
be collected for using the road passing through the gift village for
the transit of articles of merchandise, presents to be made to
the king or landlord on occasions, especially on his return from
a victorious campaign, etc. See hastidaṇḍa-varabalīvarda …
above. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 402.
text.7134:
svacchand-opabhogen = opabhoktum, refers to the right of the
donee to enjoy the gift land according to his own free will.
Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 399.
text.7135:
sva-sīmā-paryanta (EI 23), ‘as far as its boundaries’;
epi
thet of gift land.
text.7136:
sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-gocara-goyūti-paryanta (EI 23), ‘as far as the
grass land on the boundaries as well as the pasture lands and
goyūti’. Goyūti may be an enclosure for cattle.
text.7137:
sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-kāṣṭha-yūti-gocara-paryanta (EI 23), ‘as far as
the yūti (preserve) of grass and wood as well as the pasture
lands on the boundaries’.
text.7138:
sva-sīmā-tṛṇayūti-gocara-paryanta (EI 23), ‘as far as the
preserve of grass as well as the pasture lands on the boun
daries’.
text.7139:
sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-goyūthī-gocara-paryanta, same as sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-
yūti-gocara-paryanta, yūthī being a synonym of yūti (also spelt
pūti), probably meaning ‘a preserve’. See sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-gocara-
goyūti-paryanta, etc. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 394.
text.7140:
sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-yūti-gocara-paryanta, ‘as far as its boundaries,
the yūti of grass and pasture land’;
cf. Ind. Ep., p. 397.
text.7141:
sva-sīm-āvacchinna, ‘with its boundaries demarcated’;
epi
thet of gift village. Cf. Ind. Ep., p. 395.
text.7142:
talabhedyā-ghāṇaka-mallaka-vundaka-daṇḍadoṣa-prāpt-ādāya (Ind.
Ant., Vol. XVIII, p. 83, text lines 19-20), see the words as
noticed separately above.
text.7144:
tila-darbh-odaka-pavitra-pāṇinā (Ep. Ind., Vol. XXXV, p.
135, text line 23), cf. udaka-pūrvam, etc.
text.7145:
tṛṇa-kāṣṭh-odak-opeta (EI 23), ‘together with grass and
fuel and the waters’.
text.7146:
tṛṇa-pūti (or yūti) gocara-paryanta (EI 12), epithet of
gift land;
see sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-yūti (or pūti)-gocara-paryanta, etc.
text.7147:
udaka-pūrvam, cf. udak-ātisargeṇa, udakena, tila-darbh-odaka-
pavitra-pāṇinā, kuśa-lalā-pūta-hast-odakena, etc.
text.7148: udakena, cf. udaka-pūrvam, etc. Cf. Ind. Ep., pp. 136-37.
text.7149:
udbalika, ‘free from land tax’;
cf. utpratikara. Cf. Prakrit
ubalika (Select Inscriptions, p. 70).
text.7150:
umbara-bhedaḥ rājapuruṣāṇām = āvāsako jemakaś = ca n =
āsti, ‘there is no entry of royal officers into a house with its door
closed (referring especially to the houses of merchants away
from home on business tours abroad) nor should there be
any provision for their accommodation and meals’. See Ep.
Ind., Vol. XXV, p. 232-33.
text.7151:
uñcha-kara-bhar-ādi-vivarjita (Ep. Ind., Vol. XXXIII, p. 89);
see uñcha, etc., as noticed separately above.
text.7152:
urdhv-ādhaḥ-siddhi-yuta (IA 18), ‘together with the income
from fruits and roots.’
text.7153: utpratikara (EI 23), same as a-kiñcit-pratikara; cf. udbalika.
text.7154:
vana-vāṭikā-tṛṇa-jantu-gocara-paryanta (Ep. Ind., Vol. XXIII
p. 229), ‘including forests, gardens, grass fields and pasture
lands for cattle and animals.’
text.7155:
vāstu-kṣetra-jalādhāra-gartā-mārga-samanvita (EI 22), ‘to
gether with homestead lands, tanks, pits, pathways and roads’.
text.7156:
vātoḍarīya (EI 22), epithet of gift land;
probably a cor
ruption of vāt-ottarīya; cf. sa-bhūta-vāt-ādeya, etc.
text.7157:
yathādīyamāna -bhāgabhogakara-paravaṇikara-kūṭaka-prabhṛti-sa-
mast-ādāya, sometimes with turuṣka-daṇḍa and kumāra-gady-
āṇaka in place of kūṭaka, and hiraṇya, jalakara, gokara, nidhi-
nikṣepa, yamali-kambali, etc., added to the list. Bhāga-bhoga-
kara means ‘taxes in general together with the king's share
of grains and the periodical offerings payable to him.’ For pravaṇi-
kara, kūṭaka and yamalikambali, see the words as noticed above.
Turuṣkadaṇḍa was a tax levied from the Muhammadan sub
jects or for the defence of the kingdom from Muhammadan
attacks and Kumāra-gadyāṇa may be a tax of one gaḍyāṇa levied
on the occasion of a prince's birth. Hiraṇya is ‘tax in cash’,
jala-kara fishing tax, go-kara grazing tax, nidhi treasure-trove
and nikṣepa valuables found or accumulated on the land. Cf.
Ind. Ep., p. 397.
text.7158:
yathā-pradīyamāna-bhāga-bhoga-hiraṇy-ādika (EI 23), ‘what
ever is payable as bhāga-bhoga, hiraṇya, etc.’ See the words
as noticed separately;
also yathā-samucita-bhāga-bhoga-kara-
hiraṇy-ādi-sarva-rāja-bhāvya-pratyāya (Ind. Ep., p. 394).
text.7159:
yath-otpadyamāna-bhāga-bhog-ādika (EI 23), ‘with the power
to realise bhāga, bhoga, etc., whenever they become due.’ See
the words as noticed separately above.
text.7160:
abhiṣeka-kkāṇikkai (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
presents offered
to a king at the time of his coronation.
text.7162:
accu-taṟi, accu-ttaṟi (SITI), Tamil;
a variety of loom;
tax
payable on looms.
text.7163:
accu-vari (SITI), Tamil;
probably, the same as pŏn-vari; duty
payable for minting gold or metal into coins;
cf. akkaśālai-vari.
text.7164:
adhikāra-ppeṟu (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
probably, presents
offered to an officer.
text.7165:
adhikāra-varttanai (SITI), customary payments made to
an officer at stipulated periods.
text.7167:
aḍi-kkāśu (SITI), Tamil;
tax collected from stall-keepers
in markets.
text.7168:
āḍi-ppaccai (SITI), Tamil;
probably, prerequisites payable
in grain in the month of Āḍi after the harvest.
text.7170:
āḍukkalai-ppuṟam (SITI), Tamil;
an endowment for the
kitchen expenses of a temple.
text.7171:
akkaśālai-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable to the mint
for minting coins;
cf. accu-vari.
text.7172:
āḻ-amañji (SII 12), a levy;
explained as ‘workmen pressed
into service without wages’ (SITI);
Sanskrit viṣṭi.
text.7173:
aḻḻāya-mānyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
probably, the
right to receive a handful of grain or a prescribed quantity of
an article sold in the market as wages for measuring.
text.7174:
āḻ-nĕl, āṇĕl (SITI), Tamil;
a tax payable in paddy.
text.7175:
alpamirai (SITI), Tamil;
a minor tax payable in grains.
text.7176:
aḻu (SITI), Tamil;
a variety of market dues;
probably, the
same as aḻḻu and aḻḻāya-mānyam.
text.7177:
aḻugal-śarakku (SITI), Tamil;
the right of collecting the
refuse and waste thrown in the village.
text.7179:
ā ṉai-ccālai (SITI), Tamil;
‘an elephant stable’;
tax
payable for the maintenance of the elephant stable.
text.7180:
āṇḍ-e l13uttu-ttevai (SITI), Tamil, a tax of uncertain im
port.
text.7181:
aṅgāḍi-kkūli, aṅgāḍi-ppāṭṭam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on
bazars, shops, etc.
text.7182:
anniyāya-vāva-daṇḍa-iṟai (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
penal tax
imposed on some unauthorised item of occupation or enjoy
ment.
text.7183:
antara-viniyogam (SITI), Sanskrit;
individual share to
make up the shortage in the total revenue occasioned by the
grant of exemptions of antar-āyam or uḻ-vari.
text.7184:
antar-āyam (SITI), Sanskrit;
internal revenue;
taxes
levied by a local body;
also called uḻ-vari.
text.7185:
antarāya-kkāśu;
antarāya-ppāṭṭam (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
internal taxes;
minor taxes like the profession tax, etc., payable
to the village assembly.
text.7186:
anuvarttanai (SITI), a class of contingent dues which come
under the head varttanai.
text.7189:
araśu-ppeṟu (SITI), Tamil;
same as mahārāja-prayojana;
probably, fees collected for payment for the performance of
police duties in the rural areas.
text.7190:
ārāycci, kāriyav-ārāycci (SITI), Tamil;
cess paid for
the superintendence of transactions.
text.7191:
arcanā-bhoga, arcanā-vṛtti (SITI), Sanskrit;
land set apart
for meeting the expenses of worship (arcanā) in the village
temple.
text.7192: ariko l13i, ariśi-ttuṇḍam (SITI), taxes of uncertain import.
text.7193:
arikūli (SITI), Tamil;
dues payable in handfuls of the
stalks harvested.
text.7196:
ariśi-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax for husking paddy into
rice.
text.7197:
āṟṟaṅkarai-ttevai (SITI), Tamil;
tax for keeping the river
bund in repair.
text.7198:
āṟṟu-kkulai (SITI), Tamil;
‘river-bund’;
tax to repair
breaches in the river-bund.
text.7199:
āṟṟukkāl-amañji (SITI), Tamil;
unpaid labour to keep the
channel from the river in good repair.
text.7200:
aruntoḍu (SITI), Tamil;
‘eating-plate’;
a tax payable
according to the number of eating plates in feeding houses.
text.7201:
āśuvikaḻ-kāsu, āśuva-kkāśu, āśuva-kkaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable by the Ājīvakas or for maintaining Ājīvaka monks.
text.7203:
ātīrai (SITI), Tamil;
probably, the expenses for the ārdrā
festival in the month of Mārgal13i.
text.7204:
aṭiyuṟai (SITI), Tamil;
offerings made at the feet of a
high personage;
written differently as aḍiyiṟai, aḍiyaṟai, etc.
text.7207:
aṭṭaṇaikkāl (SITI), Tamil;
a kind of stand or pedestal
(probably of eight legs).
text.7208:
āṭṭukk-īṟai, āṭṭiṟai (SITI) Tamil;
tax on sheep;
also
called āṭṭu-vari.
text.7210:
āvaṇam (SITI), Tamil a document;
generally, a sale
deed;
also called villaiy-āvaṇam; cf. āvaṇa-kkaḻari (SITI),
place where documents like the sale-deeds, etc., are registered;
a
registration office.
text.7211:
avasara-varttanai (SITI), presents payable to an Avasara,
an officer of the royal household having the duty of bringing to
the notice of the king anything that demanded his immediate
attention.
text.7213:
baṇṇigitĕre, Kannaḍa;
a kind of levy (A. R. Ep., 1958-59,
p. 12).
text.7220:
bittu-vaṭṭa, a portion of the produce from the land irriga
ted by a tank, granted to a person who excavated or repaired
the tank (A. R. Ep., 1958-59, p. 10).
text.7221:
brāhmaṇa-rāśa(rāja)-kkāṇam (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
tax
payable by the Brāhmaṇa (purohita) to the king.
text.7222:
cakra-kāṇikkai (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
profession-tax
paid by the potters;
also called tirigai-āyam.
text.7224:
daśabandha (SITI), Sanskrit;
tax or cess levied to keep
the sources of water supply, like the tank, etc., in good repair.
text.7227: eraḍu dogarāca-ppaṇṇu (EI 30), name of a tax.
text.7228: eccoṟu (SII 13), a tax or the obligation of free feeding.
text.7230:
eḍuttu-kkoṭṭai (SITI), Tamil;
a tax of uncertain import.
text.7232:
elavai (SITI), also spelt ĕlavai; Tamil;
death-duty;
fee for
crematorium.
text.7233:
ĕ l13uttu-viniyogam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
dues payable as
ĕl13uttu for the village-accountant to be apportioned among the
villagers.
text.7234:
eṇi-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
ladder tax evidently levied
on toddy-drawers.
text.7235:
ĕṇṇĕy (SITI), Tamil;
tax levied on the oil-trade;
obligation
for the supply of oil.
text.7237:
eri-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
income from fishing in
the tank, etc.;
amount payable by the owners of the fields
irrigated by the tank for its upkeep.
text.7238:
eri-īvu (SITI), Tamil;
share in the expenses of the main
tenance of the tank.
text.7240:
er-ppŏn (SITI), Tamil;
tax to be paid in cash for each
plough;
also called er-kkaṇikkai, etc.
text.7242: erikkāḍi (SII 12), tank cess of one kāḍi of paddy per field.
text.7243:
eri-mīṉ-pāṭṭam (SII 12), a tax;
income from fish in the tank.
text.7244:
hĕjjuṅka, same as pĕrjuṅka, Kannaḍa;
name of tax.
text.7245:
iḍaṅgai-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax paid by the members of
the iḍaṅgai community or the left-hand classes.
text.7246:
iḍai-ppāṭṭam, also called iḍai-ppūṭci (SITI), Tanmil;
tax
on herdsmen or cattle-breeders.
text.7247:
iḍaittuṟai, also spelt iḍatoṟai (SITI), Tamil;
a tax of un
certain import.
text.7249: ilaivāṇiya-ppāṭṭam (SITI), tax on the sellers of betel-leaves.
text.7253:
ilāñjanai-ppeṟu, also called lāñjinai-ppeṟu, lāñjanai-ppeṟu
(SITI), Tamil;
fee for affixing the royal seal;
ilāñjanai = Sans
krit lāñchana.
text.7256:
iṟai (SII 13;
SITI), Tamil;
a general term denoting
revenue income and the taxes to be paid to government;
land tax.
text.7257:
iṟai-dravyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
explained as a
lump sum paid in lieu of land tax;
amount payable in com
mutation of the taxes payable on landed property.
text.7258:
iṟai-kāval (SITI), Tamil;
amount of deposit which yielded
interest per annum equal to the tax due on the land;
sometimes
regarded as a tax for police duties.
text.7260:
iṟaiyili-kkāśu (SITI), Tamil;
amount paid for compound
ing taxes in order to make the land tax-free;
also regarded as
the amount payable to meet the shortage in the revenue occa
sioned by the grant of exemption from tax on certain lands.
text.7261:
īraṅkolli, īraṅkoḻḻi (SITI), Tamil;
‘a washerman’;
tax
payable by washermen.
text.7263:
iruppu-kkaṭṭi (SITI), Tamil;
probably, the cake of the
Mahua seeds after the extraction of oil, largely used as soap;
tax for the manufacture and sale of such cakes.
text.7264:
iśai-kkiḍāy (SITI), Tamil;
‘beautiful ram’;
dues to be
paid for the ram kept for show;
cf. al13ag-erudu-kkāśu.
text.7265:
joḍi, also spelt śoḍi (SITI), Tamil;
name of a small quit
rent.
text.7266:
koḍai-vaḍaikkāy (SITI), Tamil;
tax on arecanuts brought
for sale.
text.7267:
kaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
revenue, tax to be paid to the
government in kind.
text.7268:
kadir-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax paid in sheaves of corn.
text.7269:
kāḍu-kāval (SITI), Tamil;
tax for the preservation and
maintenance of forests.
text.7273:
kanikĕ-kappa, kappa-kānikĕ, etc.;
customary presents;
presents from inferior to superior (EI 33).
text.7274:
kāṇikkai (EI 17, 21;
SITI), Tamil;
presents or customary
payment as offerings to the king and other high officials.
text.7275:
kaṇṇāla-kkāṇam (SII 13;
EI 28), marriage fee;
collected
by the village assembly;
same as vivāha-ppaṇam; cf. ugappār-pŏn.
text.7276:
ka ṉṉār-iṟai (SITI), Tamil;
profession tax payable by a
brazier.
text.7279:
karaṇikka-joḍi (SII 2;
SITI), quit-rent of the Karaṇam
or Karṇam (village-accountant or Paṭvārī).
text.7280:
kārāṇmai (SITI), Tamil;
a tenure with the hereditary
right of enjoyment;
cultivation right;
tax for the same;
also
known as kārāṇkiḻamai.
text.7281:
kāriya-ppeṟu (SITI), Tamil;
probably, the same as
kāriya-vārāycci, ārāycci.
text.7282:
kāriya-vārāycci (SITI), Tamil;
cess paid for the superin
tendence of transactions;
same as ārāycci.
text.7284:
karppūra-vilai (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
sale-price paid
for temple lands;
price paid for cultivation rights of temple
lands and in commutation of the taxes thereon.
text.7285:
kārttigai-kkāśu, kārttigai-kkāṇi, kārttigai-ppaccai, kārttigaiy-ariśi
(SITI), Tamil;
payments in kind in the month of Kārtti
gai, i. e. during the harvest;
cf. āḍi-ppaccai.
text.7286:
karuvi-paṇam, karivi-ppaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on the
implements in cash, probably paid by the barbers.
text.7287:
karuvūla-vari (SITI), Tamil;
fee for the safe-custody of
precious articles in the treasury;
or fee for the watch of
the treasury.
text.7288:
kāś-āyam (SITI), kāśu-āyam; Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax and
dues payable in coin;
also called kāśāya-vargam, kāśu-vargam and
kāśu-kaḍamai.
text.7290:
kāṭci (SITI), Tamil;
presents offered to a highly superior
person at the time of meeting.
text.7291:
kāṭciy-eradu-kkāśu (SITI), Tamil;
tax probably on bulls
kept for show.
text.7293:
kaṭṭaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
periodical presents made to
superiors by their subordinates.
text.7294:
kaṭṭ-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
consolidated amount
payable for the minor taxes;
also written as kaṇḍ-āyam; some
times taken as the compulsory payment of certain dues.
text.7296:
katti-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on weapons like sword,
etc., or tax on the manufacture of swords or arms.
text.7297:
kaṭṭu-kkuttagai (SITI), Tamil;
rent fixed at the time of
farming out the land;
payment of consolidated rent.
text.7298:
kaṭṭumukkai (SITI), Tamil;
‘three handfuls in the bundle’;
a contribution of three handfuls for every bundle of paddy stalks
harvested, which were payable to the temples;
cf. arimukkai.
text.7299:
kāval-peṟu (SII 12), name of a tax;
cf. kāval-kāni, the right
to guard temples.
text.7300:
ki l13-iṟai (SITI;
SII 12), Tamil;
minor taxes, or tax
fixed at a lower rate.
text.7301:
kī l13-iṟai-ppāṭṭam (SITI), Tamil;
small cesses and taxes like
mīn-pāṭṭam, etc.
text.7303:
kirukula (SITI), Tamil;
commercial tax or tolls on retail
articles;
also called kirukūla-viśeṣam; cf. kūlam.
text.7304:
kŏḍi-kkaḍami (SITI), Tamil;
explained as a tax for the
cultivation of the medicinal plant kŏḍi-veli, otherwise known as
citra-mūlam; probably, the same as kodi-kkaḍamai, tax on new
cloth;
cf. tiru-ppudiyidu.
text.7305:
kol-kūli (SITI), Tamil;
tax for measuring or weighing.
text.7306:
kol-niṟai-kūli (SITI), Tamil;
tax on articles measured
by weight.
text.7310:
ko-muṟai (SITI), Tamil;
revenue due to the king.
text.7311:
ko-pada-vāram (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax due to the king.
text.7312:
koṭṭai-kkūli (SITI);
‘wages on nuts’;
probably, charges
for the upkeep of forts;
cf. koṭṭai-magamai.
text.7313:
koṭṭai-magamai (SITI), Tamil;
tax for the maintenance of
forts.
text.7314:
koyil-vāśi (SITI), Tamil;
minor taxes payable to the
palace.
text.7315:
kuḍi-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
fee paid by the tenants;
pro
bably, the same as kuḍi-kkāśu and kuḍi-ppaṇam.
text.7316:
kuḍimai (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
taxes in general (with the
exception of land revenue) payable to the state for the protec
tion of the civil rights it offers;
tenancy tax.
text.7318:
kudirai-ppandi (SITI), Tamil;
‘a stable’;
tax for the same.
text.7319:
kudirai-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax on horses;
also known
as kudirai-māṟṟu, kudiraiv-ilāḍam; probably the same as kudirai-
ppandi.
text.7320:
kudiraiv-ilāḍam (SITI), Tamil;
‘horse-shoe’;
fee for
shoeing horses;
probably connected with kudirai-ppandi.
text.7321:
kuḻavaḍai (EI 17), tax for the enjoyment of the tank
and its income.
text.7322:
kūlam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on grains and pulses;
cf.
kirukulam.
text.7323:
kumara-kaccāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
explained as a tax pay
able in coin for the maintenance of the temple of Kumāra or
Subrahamaṇya;
but same as kumāra-gadyāṇa (q. v.).
text.7324:
kūṟṟariśi (SITI), Tamil;
obligation of husking paddy be
longing to the temple into rice and the charges to be met for the
same.
text.7325:
kuṟṟu-nĕl, kūṟṟu-nĕllu (SITI), Tamil;
tax for husking
paddy payable to king.
text.7326:
kuśa-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on potters;
also known
as tirigaiāyam, śakkara-kkāṇikkai.
text.7328:
māḍai-kkūli (SITI), Tamil;
tax for minting gold into coins.
text.7329:
mādā-ppaḍi (SITI), Tamil;
allowances payable monthly;
also called mādārikka, mādan and mādārikkai.
text.7330:
māḍu-kāṇikkai (SITI), Tamil;
obligation of supplying
draught cattle to the visiting nobles by the tenants.
text.7331:
magamai, maganmai, magaṇamai (SITI), Tamil;
small
portion of the income or of the value of articles of merchandise
collected as voluntary contribution by the merchants from among
themselves for the maintenance of temples, etc.
text.7333:
makkaḻ-peṟu (SITI), Tamil;
one's obligations as a citizen;
probably, dues payable to a temple, or poll-tax.
text.7334:
mallāyi-maghamai (SITI), Tamil;
probably a customary
collection in the market.
text.7335:
māmagam (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable in cash probably
for the great Māgha (Mahāmāgha) festival;
or, a mistake for
mārgam.
text.7336:
manai-meyppān-koḻḻum-iṟai, tax for the supervisor of houses
or the building-supervisor;
cf. meyppān (SITI), Tamil;
‘shep
herd;
grazier;’ a supervisor;
probably related to kaṇkāṇi.
text.7337:
manai-ppaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
house tax;
also called manai-
vari. Cf. ilvari.
text.7339:
mandai-ppaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on cattle grazing in
the village common.
text.7340:
maṇḍala-mudanmai-ppeṟu (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
fee for
presents offered to the rulers of the maṇḍala or district.
text.7341:
maṇ-madil (SITI), Tamil;
‘high wall or rampart made
of mud’;
tax for the erection and upkeep of such a wall.
text.7342:
māppadakku (SITI), Tamil;
payment at the rate of one
padakku or two kuruṇi for every mā.
text.7343:
māppaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
a tax payable at the rate of
one paṇam for every mā.
text.7344:
māppaṭṭaḍai (SITI), Tamil;
tax probably for the penning
of cattle;
may also be mara-ppaṭṭaḍai, ‘a timber depot’;
tax
payable for the same.
text.7346:
mara-mañjāḍi (SITI), Tamil;
tax of one mañjāḍi for every
tree.
text.7347:
mārg-ādāyam (SITI), Sanskrit;
tolls on the articles in transit.
text.7348:
mariyādi (SITI), Tamil;
customary dues;
also spelt mar-
jādi, mariśādi, maruśādi, etc., and used in the sense of manner,
way, extent, limit.
text.7349:
māṭṭukkaṟai (SITI), Tamil;
probably, a tax on cattle
(cows and buffaloes).
text.7350:
māvinda-kkaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable to the king.
text.7353:
mel-vĕṭṭa-pperu (SITI), land set apart for meeting expenses
of public works (vĕṭṭi).
text.7355:
merai (SITI), Tamil;
portion of the crop given at the
threshing floor to certain village officers and servants as per
quisite.
text.7356:
mer-pāḍi-kāval (SITI), Tamil;
policing duty over the nāḍu.
See nāḍu-kāval.
text.7357:
meṭṭu-nilam (SITI), Tamil;
‘high land’;
tax payable for
the cultivation of such land.
text.7359:
monampāṭṭam (SITI), Tamil;
a tax of uncertain import.
text.7360:
mudaṟṟiraman, mudal-tiramam (SITI), Tamil;
tax (payable
in cash) of uncertain import;
tiramam is the coin called dramma
(from Greek drachma).
text.7361:
muḻḻaḍiśinnam (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
a tax of uncertain
import;
probably, payment for clue in detection.
text.7363:
muttāvaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
a tax probably on the sale
of pearls.
text.7364:
nāḍu-kāval (SITI), Tamil;
‘policing duty of the nāḍu’;
tax payable by the residents in the division for the same.
text.7365:
nāḍu-talaiyārikkam (SITI), Tamil;
police-tax of the nāḍu;
same as nāḍu-kāval.
text.7366:
nal-kiḍā, naṟ-kiḍā (SITI), Tamil;
cess for the upkeep of
the show-ram;
or, tax for show-rams.
text.7367:
nall-ĕrudu (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
cess for the maintenance
of a model bull, which was probably also used for breeding pur
poses;
cf. al13agerudu-kkāśu, kāṭci-ĕrudu-kkāśu, etc.
text.7368:
nall-erumai (SITI), tax for the maintenance of specimen
buffaloes.
text.7370:
nāṭṭu-kkaṇakku-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable for the
maintenance of the revenue accounts of the nāḍu or the country
as a whole.
text.7371:
nāṭu-kkāṇikkai (SITI), Tamil;
presents payable to or by
the assembly of the nāḍu.
text.7372:
nāṭṭupāti (SITI), Tamil;
nāḍu-upādi; the obligations to
be met and taxes payable to the local assembly of the nāḍu.
text.7373:
nāṭṭu-viniyogam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
individual share
payable to make up the shortage in the total revenue by the
grant of exemptions by the assembly of the nāḍu.
text.7374:
nĕll-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax payable in paddy;
also known as nĕṟ-kaḍamai.
text.7375:
nĕy (SITI), Tamil;
tax on the traders in ghee;
same as
nĕy-vilai; cf. also eṇṇĕy.
text.7377:
nīrāṇikka-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax for the supervision of
the regulation of water supply in a village.
text.7382:
nūl-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax on cotton thread
for weaving cloth.
text.7383:
oḻi-vaṇṇāṟ-pāṟai (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable by the washer
man calculated on the number of washing stones.
text.7384:
paccai-ppaṇam (SITI), Tamil;
payment in cash towards
the obligation of paccai payable in kind;
also referred to as
paccai-ppāṭṭam. Cf. Kārttigai-paccai, etc.
text.7385:
paḍai-ppaṇam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax for the main
tenance of an army unit or fee from the army;
also known as
paḍai-kkāṇikkai.
text.7386:
paḍan-ka l13i (SITI), Tamil;
an obligation of uncertain
import.
text.7387:
pāḍavari (SITI), Tamil;
tax probably on metallic mir
rors.
text.7388:
padavāram, also spelt paduvāram (SITI), Tamil;
fee pay
able for exchanging landed property;
transfer fee.
text.7389:
pāḍikkāval (SITI), Tamil;
‘watch or the police duties
of the village’;
contribution for the same.
text.7393:
paṇa-vargam (SITI), Sanskrit;
class of taxes payable in
cash;
same as kāśāya-vargam; cf. paṇam, coin, money.
text.7394:
paṇa-vāśi (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
discount payable for
the exchange of coins;
amount payable to make up the wear
in the coin.
text.7395:
pañca-vārav-ūr-iḍu-vari (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
levied by
the pañca-vāriyam (the five committees) of the local assembly (ūr).
text.7396:
pañcu-ppīli (SITI EI 24), Tamil;
tax on cotton;
also
referred to as pāñjupili.
text.7397:
paṇḍa-vĕṭṭi (SITI), Tamil;
a variety of vĕṭṭi, probably
for the temple lands.
text.7398:
pāṇḍivari (SITI), Tamil;
probably tax on carts drawn
by bulls.
text.7399:
paṇi-kkŏttu (SITI), Tamil;
‘village servants’;
cess collec
ted for their maintenance.
text.7400:
paṇ-kuṟuṇi (SITI), Tamil;
cess payable at the rate of one
kuṟuṇi of the produce for each field.
text.7402:
pāṟai-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax on washing stone pay
able by washermen;
sometimes explained as the tax on quarries.
text.7403:
paṟai-ttaṟi (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
a variety of hand
loom;
the tax for the same.
text.7404:
paṟaiy-iṟai (SITI), Tamil;
a tax [payable in cash] pro
bably for tomtoms.
text.7408:
paṭṭāḍai-nūl-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax on silk
thread used for weaving cloth.
text.7409:
paṭṭaḍai-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax probably for the use
of the threshing floor.
text.7410:
pāṭṭam (SITI EI 21), Tamil;
tax or rent;
payable pro
bably for an industry or a profession.
text.7411:
pāṭṭa-nĕl (SITI), Tamil;
paddy to be paid by the tenant
to the landlord as per terms of lease.
text.7412:
paṭṭaya-kkāṇikkai (SITI), Tamil;
fee for the issue of royal
charters.
text.7413:
paṭṭi-kkāḍi (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable in grain at the
rate of one kāḍi for each paṭṭi of land.
text.7414:
paṭṭi-kkāl (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable in cash at the
rate of one fourth (probably of paṇam) for each paṭṭi of land.
text.7415:
paṭṭigai-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
obligation to pay at the
rate of one kāṇam for each paṭṭi of land;
probably, the same as
paṭṭaya-kkāṇikkai.
text.7417:
paṭṭi-ttaṇḍam (SITI), Tamil;
probably, punitive tax of a
village.
text.7419:
pĕjjuṅka (EI 8-5), Kannaḍa;
name of tax;
also spelt
pĕrjuṅka, pĕrujuṇka, hĕjjuṅka; probably derived from piriya-
suṅka = Sanskrit bṛhac-chulka.
text.7421:
pĕr-kkaḍamai (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
explained as
poll tax, the same as āḻvari; (also called pervāśi);
but may be a
payment to be made on the occasion of the naming ceremony
of a child.
text.7423:
perum-pāḍi-kāval (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
police duties of
a larger area, as distinct from the śiṟu-pāḍi-kāval for the village.
text.7426:
pracaṇḍa-kāṇikkai (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
a variety of
military cess;
this is found mentioned along with other military
cessess like paḍai-ppaṇam, etc.
text.7428:
puḍā-na l13i (SITI), Tamil;
probably, a local cess on each
door or gate or house;
also, mentioned as pidā-nāl13i.
text.7429:
pulavari (SITI), Tamil;
‘tax on a pulam (piece of land)’;
probably to be corrected as pulvari meaning ‘tax on grass.’
text.7430: pullavari (SITI), tax payable for grazing cattle.
text.7431:
pullandi (SITI), Tamil;
an obligation probably con
nected with the pasture land in the form of fine on stray cattle.
text.7432:
pu l13ugu-kaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
fee for meeting the ex
penses of coating the image of gods with civet;
also known as
pul13uguvari.
text.7433:
puṟa-kkaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
external taxes, i. e., taxes
and fees payable to the state.
text.7434:
puṟav-āyam (SITI), Tamil;
revenue from external sour
ces, collected mainly in cash.
text.7435:
puṟavĕṭṭi (SITI), Tamil;
a variety of vĕṭṭi for public
work, probably outside the area in question.
text.7439:
śakkara-kkāṇikkai (SITI), Tamil;
tax on potters;
also
known as tirigai-āyam; cf. kuśa-kkāṇam.
text.7440:
śaṇḍāla-ppeṟu (SITI), Tamil;
a local cess or tax collec
ted from or for the Caṇḍālas.
text.7441:
sandhivigraha-ppeṟu (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
fee payable
to the village madhyastha; also a fee payable to the document
writers.
text.7442:
śaṭṭu-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax for the grazing ground in
the village.
text.7444:
śekk-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax on oil-presses;
also called śekk-iṟai and śekku-kkaḍamai (SII 12).
text.7446:
śekku-ma ṉṟāḍi (SITI), Tamil;
a tax or cess;
probably.
related to śekku.
text.7447:
seṅkŏḍi-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
explained as ‘the tax on
the cultivation of the medicinal plant known variously as
śeṅgŏḍi, kŏḍiveli and citramūlam’;
see also kŏḍi-kkāṇam.
text.7448:
śeṭṭiyār-magamai (SITI), Tamil;
voluntary contribution
(magamai) of the merchants.
text.7449:
śeṭṭiy-iṟai (SITI), Tamil;
tax on merchants;
also known
as śeṭṭ-iṟai.
text.7450:
śevaka-kkāśu (SITI), Tamil;
fee for the maintenance of
the soldiers;
or, tax levied on the soldier.
text.7451:
śil-kuḍimai (SITI), minor taxes and cesses payable to
the local authority.
text.7452:
śill-antar-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
minor taxes which
fall in the group of antar-āyam or uḻ-vari.
text.7460:
śŏ ṉa-vari (SITI), Tamil;
same as pŏn-vari; explained as
‘tax payable in gold’;
but may be professional tax payable by
the goldsmiths;
cf. suvarṇa-daṇḍa.
text.7461:
śuḍu-kāṭṭu-ppāṭṭam (SITI), Tamil;
fee payable by a
prostitute, especially those accompanying the army.
text.7462:
śūla-vari (EI 25;
SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
a tax payable
for the unkeep probably of a Śiva temple.
text.7463: suṅka (EI 12), same as Sanskrit śulka, tolls.
text.7465:
svarṇ-ādāyam (SITI), Sanskrit;
revenue in gold;
taxes
payable in coin;
or, profession tax payable by the goldsmiths.
text.7467:
taḻai-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
fee or tax on the taḻai or
foot-binding used by toddy-tappers.
text.7468:
talaiyārikkam (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable for the main
tenance of the village watchman;
same as talaiyāri-kkāṇi.
text.7469:
taṇḍaliṟ-kaḍamai, taṇḍaṟ-kaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
fee pay
able for the maintenance of tax-collectors;
or, tax on bill
collectors.
text.7470:
taṇḍa-kkāṇam, laṇḍa-kkuṟam, etc. (SITI), in which taṇḍa
is punitive tax and kuṟṟam fines for crimes committed.
text.7472:
tāniya-varakkam, dhānya-varga (SITI), Sanskrit;
‘the grain
group’;
class of taxes payable in grains.
text.7475:
tarav-iḍu-nĕl (SITI), Tamil;
paddy given in lieu of wages.
text.7476:
taravu (SITI), Tamil;
‘that which has been given’;
collec
tion of debt or tax on pressure;
also a dun;
also used in the
sense of ‘order or instruction’.
text.7477:
taravu-kŏḻḻudal (SITI), Tamil;
‘to obtain a receipt for
anything given’;
collection of tax exercising pressure.
text.7482:
taṟi-ppuḍavai (SITI), Tamil;
tax on looms payable in the
shape of cloth.
text.7483:
taṟi-taḻai (SITI), Tamil;
tax on looms;
probably, the
same as taṟi-kkaḍamai.
text.7484:
taṭṭār-pāṭṭam, taṭṭāra-ppāṭṭam (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
tax
on goldsmiths. Cf. suvarṇa-daṇḍa noticed above.
text.7485:
taṭṭ-ŏli (SITI), Tamil;
mentioned along with taṭṭār-
pāṭṭam; probably, tax on the smiths or the workshop of the
artisans like the blacksmiths.
text.7486:
taṭṭu-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
same as taṭṭār-pāṭṭam; ‘fee
for hammering’;
probably also the same as taṭṭukk-āyam.
text.7488:
tiṅgaḻ-kāśu (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable every month;
cf.
tiṅgaṭ-coṟu, tiṅgaḻ-nĕy, tiṅgaḻ-mogam, etc. Cf. also māda-ppaḍi.
text.7489:
tirigai-āyam (SITI), tax payable by the potter for his trade;
cf. tirigai, a potter's wheel.
text.7490:
tiru-muga-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
expenses as wages, etc.,
payable to the person who brings the tiru-mugam (royal order)
to a village.
text.7491:
tivu l13-desa (EI 30), Tamil;
name of a tax.
text.7492:
tīyeṟi-śoṟu (SII 13), Tamil;
literally, ‘offering in fire’;
supposed to be the name of a tax.
text.7493:
tol-ŏṭṭu (SITI), Tamil;
a fee probably connected with
hides and skins.
text.7495:
toraṇa-kkāṇikkai (SITI), Tamil;
presents for decorating
the village with arches, etc.;
or tax on gates.
text.7498:
tūśaka-ttaṟi (SITI), Tamil;
tax probably on looms
weaving tent-materials.
text.7499:
ugappār-pŏn (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable in gold on joyous
occasions like marriage;
probably the same as kaṇṇāla-kkāṇam.
text.7500:
ulavu-kāṭci (SITI), Tamil;
probably, presents offered to
the king or other exalted persons when going in procession
round the village.
text.7502:
ulliya-kkūli (SITI), Tamil;
probably, water-fee for irri
gation from wells;
tax or wages for well-digging.
text.7503:
uluppai (SITI), Tamil;
presents of fruits, articles of food,
etc., offered to great personages;
free supplies made by the
people or subordinates to officials on tour.
text.7504:
uḻ-vari (SITI), Tamil;
internal revenue;
taxes levied
by the local body;
same as antar-āyam; orders issued by the
government fixing the amount of such taxes.
text.7506:
ural-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax or fee for the maintenance
of the mortar for husking paddy.
text.7507:
ūr-ĕṭṭu (SITI), Tamil;
‘committee of eight members of
the village assembly (ūr)’;
taxes payable for the expenses of
the committee.
text.7508:
ūr-iḍu-varippāḍu (SII 13;
SITI), Tamil;
tax levied by
the village assembly (ūr).
text.7509:
ūr-kkaḍamai (SITI), Tamil;
obligations and taxes pay
able to the village assembly (ūr).
text.7512:
uvacca-vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable by or for the main
tenance of the uvaccar (drummers in temple service).
text.7513:
uvacca-kkāṇi (SITI), Tamil;
rent-free land given to the
uvaccaṉ for serving as drummer in a temple.
text.7514:
vaḍḍarāvuḻa, vaḍḍāravuḻa (EI 19, 28;
IE 8-8), Kannaḍa;
name of a tax.
text.7515:
vagainda-kāśu (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable in cash for
marking the details, as of land;
fees for subdivision of land;
also the fee for settlement, as of a dispute.
text.7516:
vāla-mañjāḍi (SITI), Tamil;
probably the same as vāla-
vari and vāla-kkāṇam; tax of a mañjāḍi on the units of measure
ment in the length of a house-site.
text.7517:
valaṅgai-iḍaṅgai-maganmai (SITI), Tamil;
tax on the right
hand and left-hand castes, to be paid by all able-bodied men
capable of bearing arms.
text.7519:
va l13iy-āyam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
tolls on the roadways.
text.7520:
va l13udiy-accu-vargam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
group of
taxes payable in Pāṇḍya coins.
text.7522:
va ṉ-pāṭṭam (SITI), Tamil;
fixed rent in kind due under
a lease-deed which does not provide for any relief against loss
due to drought.
text.7523:
vari (SITI), Tamil;
tax, revenue register, order of the
king and his officer fixing the revenue;
cf. vari-ppŏttagam, tax
register;
officer maintaining the same;
also Vari-kkūṟu-śeyvār,
Varrikkukkūṟu-śeyvār (SITI), Tamil;
officers grading the culti
vable land and fixing the tax payable thereon.
text.7524:
variśai (SITI), Tamil;
village dues;
cess payable by or
to the local authority.
text.7525:
vāśalil-ponda-kuḍimai (SITI), Tamil;
‘burden of citizen
ship dues at the gate’;
taxes, probably other than the land
revenue, payable to the state.
text.7526:
vāśal-kāṇikkai, (SITI), Tamil;
presents offered to the palace,
probably annually.
text.7527:
vāśal-ku l13i-ppaṇam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
probably, door
tax, i. e., house-tax based on the main doorways.
text.7528:
vāśal-paṇam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
periodical payment
due to the palace;
door-tax.
text.7529:
vāśal-tiramam (SITI), Tamil;
door-tax;
tiramam is the
same as dramma.
text.7532:
vaṭṭi-nā l13i (SITI), Tamil;
probably, a tax payable at the
rate of one nāl13i for each vaṭṭi.
text.7533:
vāykkāl-pāṭṭam (SITI), Tamil;
channel cess;
fee for keep
ing the channels in good repairs.
text.7534:
veli-kkāśu (SITI), Tamil;
tax (payable in cash) of
uncertain import;
cf. veli-kkul13i-ppaṇam.
text.7537:
veṇḍugoḻ, veṇḍukoḻ (SII 12;
SITI), Tamil;
supplication;
petition;
fee for the same;
also known as veṇḍukoḻ-vari.
text.7540:
veyadi-kāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax payable in grains, pro
bably on thatched sheds;
or, may be related to veynĕl (collection
of bamboo-grain from forests).
text.7541:
vibhūti-kāṇikkai (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
contribution paid
voluntarily to a temple by its devotees while receiving the
sacred ashes, later collected as compulsory dues.
text.7542:
viḍai-pper, viḍai-ppeṟu (SITI), Tamil;
perquisites payable
on the receipt of a reply to a petition to the king.
text.7543:
vil-paṇam (SITI), Tamil-Sanskrit;
sale-tax;
also explain
ed as a tax on bows or on archery.
text.7544:
vipravinodi-vari (SITI), Sanskrit-Tamil;
tax from or for the
maintenance of the Vipravinodins (Brāhmaṇa magicians).
text.7545:
vīra-śeṣai (SITI);
EI 22), sometimes supposed to be the
name of a tax;
but see vīra-śeṣa.
text.7546:
viṟ-paṇam (SITI), vil-paṇam; Tamil-Sanskrit;
tax on bows
and arrows;
may also be a tax on sales.
text.7547:
viruttu-ppaṭṭigai (SITI), Tamil;
tax probably on profits
and the income from interest.
text.7548:
viśa-kkāṇam (SITI), Tamil;
tax or share in the produce
as remuneration due to a Viyavaṉ or village headman.
text.7549:
viśeṣ-āyam, viśeṣ-ādāyam (SITI), Sanskrit;
a special group
of taxes.
text.7551:
accu, Tamil;
name of a coin;
money;
tax or income.
text.7552: āchu, same as āsu; cf. accu.
text.7553:
āḍa, also spelt aḍḍa; name of a coin;
half of a fanam; cf.
aḍḍaga and aḍḍuga.
text.7556: aḍḍa-cinna, cf. āḍa or aḍḍa and cinna or sinna.
text.7557: aḍḍaga, also spelt aḍḍuga; same as āḍa, aḍḍa.
text.7559:
aḍi-kkāśu, ‘tax collected from the stall-keepers in the
market’;
see kāśu.
text.7560:
aḍimai-kkāśu, ‘fee collected from the temple servants (or
for their maintenance)’;
see kāśu.
text.7561:
ādivarāha-dramma, ‘a dramma issued by Ādivarāha (Patīhāra
Bhoja I, c. 836-85 A. D.)’;
same as śrīmad-ādivarāha-dramma;
see dramma.
text.7562:
ādya-māṣa, the original māṣa of 5 ratis as opposed to the
later māṣa of various weights upto 10 ratis. Cf. māṣa.
text.7563:
ājīvaka-kāśu, same as Tamil āśuva-kkāśu; ‘tax collected from
the Ājivakas (or for the maintenance of the Ājīvaka monks)’;
see
kāśu.
text.7564: akkam, one-twelfth of a kāśu (q. v.).
text.7570: āṇaka, Sanskritized form of Muhammadan āna = English anna.
text.7571:
aṇdika, aṇḍikā, (1/4) of a māṣa; also regarded as the same as
paṇa which was (1/12) or (1/16) of a dīnāra or suvarṇa in value.
text.7573:
anna, Anglicised form of Muhammadan āna; (1/16) of rupee,
property, etc.
text.7574: ardha-kakinī, half of a kākinī (q. v.).
text.7578:
āśuva-kkāśu, same as ājīvaka-kāśu (q. v.);
see kāśu.
text.7580:
aureus, Roman gold coin (124 grains);
same as the gold
denareus (q. v.).
text.7581: badara, same as tola or tolaka.
text.7583:
balotra, name applied to an Indian silver coin by the
Muslim chroniclers of the early medieval period.
text.7584: barāḍ, modified form of varāṭaka (q. v.).
text.7588:
bhairava-gadyāṇa ‘a gadyāṇa minted by a goldsmith
named Bhairava’;
cf. bṛhat-bhairava-gadyāṇa; see gadyāṇa.
text.7589:
bhīmapriya-dramma, ‘a dramma minted by a goldsmith named
Bhīma’;
see dramma.
text.7590:
bhujabala-māḍai, ‘a māḍai issued by a ruler named or enti
tled Bhujabala’;
see māḍa, māḍai.
text.7593:
bu ḏī, Bengali name for a unit equal to 5 gaṇḍās; cf. voḍī,
voḍrī, kapardaka-voḍī; also kākinī.
text.7594:
cāmara, also called cāmara-māḍa; probably ‘a māḍa bearing
the figure of a fly-whisk’;
see māḍa.
text.7596: carsam (karṣa ?), equal to 4 māḍas; see māḍa.
text.7600: cau-gānī, (1/2) of an aṭha-gānī or ṭaṅka.
text.7601: cavala, also spelt cavela; (1/8) of a pagoda (q. v.).
text.7603: cha-gānī, (3/4) of an aṭha-gānī or ṭaṅka.
text.7605:
cinna, also spelt sinna; same as fanam (q. v.);
(1/8) of a
pagoda (q. v.)
text.7606:
ciravida, Telugu;
supposed to be a kind of gadyāṇa (q. v.).
text.7607:
dām, derivative of dramma (q. v.);
copper coin, (1/40) of a
Mughal rupee (q. v.).
text.7608: dama, same as dāma or dramma (q. v.).
text.7609: dāma, same as dām or dramma (q. v.).
text.7611:
ḍāṅg, corrupt form of ṭanka (q. v.);
cf. dāṅk.
text.7612:
dāṅk, corrupt form of ṭaṅka (q. v.);
cf. ḍāṅg.
text.7613:
daric, gold coin of ancient Iran (about 133 grains);
double
daric = Greek stater or tetradrachma, four times the drachma in weight.
text.7614:
dāya-dramma, ‘tax or money to be paid’;
see dramma.
text.7616:
denarius, name of the Roman silver (also gold) coin;
equal
to Greek drachma; origin of the Indian coin name dīnāra, etc.
text.7617:
dhānaka, same as māṣa; cf. hemadhānyaka; same as dhānika
(q. v.);
also called aṇḍika and regarded as equal to 4 kārṣāpaṇas
or (1/12) of suvarṇa (JNSI, Vol. II, p. 8).
text.7618:
dhānika, equal to 4 kārṣāpaṇas or 64 paṇas according to the
Kṛtyakalpataru.
text.7620:
dharaṇa, old silver coin of 32 ratis (about 58 grains);
also
called kārṣāpaṇa and purāṇa; 24 (actually about 20) ratis in
weight and half of gadyāṇa in value according to medieval autho
rities;
otherwise called dramma, śāna or ṭaṅka; sometimes regarded
as a gold coin or weight equal to ten palas or 40 suvarṇas or niṣkas
(3200 ratis);
cf. śalamāna (silver) = 10 dharaṇas (320 ratis).
text.7621: dhvaṃśi, same as vaṃśya; a minute unit of measurement.
text.7623:
‘die-struck’, coins on which the symbols and legends were
impressed by means of an anvil and a single punch, both bear
ing negative representations, by placing a blank on the socket
in the anvil and striking the punch placed on it by a hammer;
see punch-marked.
text.7624:
dināra, also spelt dinnāra; generally spelt dīnāra (q. v.);
a cowrie-shell according to the Kashmir chronicle.
text.7625:
dīnāra, derived from Roman denarius (124 grains);
name of
a gold coin equal to 16 silver coins called rūpaka, etc. (about 20
ratis);
a silver coin according to the Kṛtyakalpataru; sometimes
called kāśu in Tamil, etc.;
sometimes regarded as half of satera
or sateraka (Greek stater);
see dināra.
text.7626:
dināri, generally spelt as dīnāra; local modification of
the Roman denarius prevalent in the Ikṣvāku kingdom in the
Krishna-Guntur region.
text.7627:
dināri-māṣaka, same as dināri, or one-sixteenth of a dināri
or dīnāra in weight or value.
text.7631: do-gānī, (1/4) of an aṭha-gānī or ṭaṅka.
text.7633:
drachma, Greek silver coin;
equal to 6 obols; Attic standard
67 grains, but the Indo-Greek standard was soon modified, their
coins of 37 or 38 grains being called drachma or hemi-drachma by
different scholars;
origin of the Indian coin name dramma (q. v.).
text.7634:
drakṣaṇa, same as draṃkṣana or tola; equal to 8 māṣas (80
ratis);
cf. drakṣuṇa.
text.7635: drakṣuṇa, same as drakṣaṇa or tola.
text.7638:
dramma, Indian form of Greek drachma; a silver coin (1/16) of
a gold niṣka according to the Līlāvatī; name applied to the
Śaka-type silver purāṇa, dharaṇa or kārṣāpaṇa (about 20 ratis,
also called rūpaka);
copper coin (dām) regarded as (1/40) of a
Mughal rupee; money in general;
the name first occurs on the
Yaudheya coins.
text.7646:
fanam, Anglicised form of Tamil paṇam (q. v.);
Sanskrit
paṇa (q. v.);
a gold coin equal to (1/20) of a varāha.
text.7650:
gadiāṇaka, cf. kumāra-gadiāṇaka, name of a tax;
same as gadyāṇa.
text.7651:
gadhiyā, also spelt gadhaiyā; copper coin imitated from old
Sasanian issues.
text.7656:
gadyāṇa, a gold coin or weight;
generally regarded as 48
ratis (about 88 grains) in weight;
sometimes called ‘the gold
gadyāṇa’;
sometimes regarded as a coin like a farthing, equal
to (1/4) or (1/5) of the paikamu (q. v.);
regarded in some places as
equal to 20 vals, 8 māṣas or (1/2) tola.
text.7657: gadyānaka, same as gadyāṇaka or gadyāṇa (q. v.).
text.7659:
gadyāṇa-ponnu, ‘gadyāṇa of gold’;
same as pon-gadyāṇa; see
gadyāṇa.
text.7660:
gaṇḍā, equal to 4 cowrie-shells;
(1/20) of a paṇa; cf. gaṇḍaka.
text.7661:
gaṇḍagopālaṉ-māḍai, ‘māḍa issued or minted by
Gaṇḍagopāla’;
see māḍai.
text.7662: gaṇḍaka, same as gaṇḍā. Cf. kākinī.
text.7663:
gaṇḍa-māḍa, probably ‘māḍa bearing the figure of a rhi
noceros’ or an abbreviation of Gaṇḍagopālan-māḍai (q. v.);
sometimes characterised by the epithet ‘small’;
sometimes
also called kārṣāpaṇa, niṣka and gaṇḍa-niṣka; see māḍa.
text.7664: gaṇḍa-niṣka, same as gaṇḍa; see māḍa and niṣka.
text.7665:
gandhahasti-māḍa, same as gandhavāraṇa-māḍa; probably,
‘māḍa bearing the figure of an elephant in rut’;
see māḍa.
text.7666: gānī, cf. aṭha-gānī, equal to a ṭaṅka and weighing a tola.
text.7673:
gulikā, same as golakā, etc.;
a small coin apparently
globular or circular in shape;
supposed to be a coin issued by
the Śambhuvarāya chiefs and also by the Pāṇḍyas;
cf. vīra-
champan-kuḻigai and vaḻḻāl-val13i-tiṟantāṉ-guḻikai.
text.7674: guñjā, same as rati or raktikā (1-83 or about 1(3/4) grains).
text.7675:
hāga, Kannaḍa;
same as Sanskrit bhāga; probably (1/4) of
the standard coin;
see pāga.
text.7677: hema, same as māṣa; cf. hema-dhānyaka.
text.7678: hema-dhānyaka, same as māṣa; see hema and dhānaka.
text.7680:
hemi-drachma, Greek;
same as Sanskrit dramm-ārdha (q. v.);
see drachma, dramma, etc.
text.7681:
hon, variant spelling of hūn; same as varāha, gadyāṇa (gold
gadyāṇa) and pagoda (star pagoda);
cf. suvarṇa.
text.7682: hūn, same as hon or varāha (q. v.), etc.
text.7688:
jīrṇa-śreṣṭhi-śrīmalla-priya, possibly, ‘an old coin of the mint
of Śreṣṭhin Śrīmalla’.
text.7689:
jīrṇa-śreṣṭhi-viśvamalla-priya, same as jīrṇa-viśvamalla-priya;
possibly, ‘an old coin of the mint of Śreṣṭhin Viśvamalla’.
text.7690:
jītal, a copper coin, (1/48) of a silver ṭanka of the Delhi
Sulṯāns;
also called delhīwāl; (1/3) of a silver tār which was
itself (1/6) of a fanam.
text.7691:
jīrṇa-viśvamalla-priya, same as jīrṇa-śreṣṭhi-viśvamalla-priya,
possibly, ‘an old coin of the mint of Viśvamalla’;
cf. vīsala-
priya-dramma.
text.7692:
ka ḏā, Bengali, etc;
cowrie-shell regarded as coin;
(1/4)
of gaṇḍā and (1/80) of paṇa in some areas. Cf. kapardaka, etc.
text.7693:
kāhaṇa, Bengali, etc;
also spelt kahāṇa and kāhāṇa; same
as kāhāpaṇa = kārṣāpaṇa.
text.7696:
kāhāpaṇa, same as Sanskrit kārṣāpaṇa and modern kāhaṇ,
etc.
text.7698: kākanikā, same as kakanī, kakinī (q. v.).
text.7699:
kakinī, equal to 20 cowrie-shells according to the Līlāvatī;
(1/4) of a paṇa; same as buḏī. Cf. gaṇḍā
text.7700:
ka l13añju, Tamil;
name of a weight or coin weighing 10
mañjāḍis (32 ratis theoretically);
sometimes called suvarṇa (q. v.).
text.7701:
kāṇam, Tamil;
name of a coin;
a gold coin or weight.
text.7702:
kāṇikĕ, also spelt kāṇiki; (1/64) part of a coin;
money or tolls.
text.7704:
kaparda, same as kapardaka, etc.;
cowrie-shell used as
coin.
text.7705:
kapardaka, also called kaparda, kapardikā, kapardī, etc.;
cowrie
shell used as coin. Cf. kaḏā.
text.7706: kapardaka-purāṇa, ‘a purāṇa (q. v.) counted in kapardakas’.
text.7707:
kapardaka-voḍī, ‘a voḍī counted in kapardakas’;
cf. buḏī and
voḍī.
text.7708: kapardī, same as kapardikā, kapardaka, etc.
text.7709: kapardikā, same as kapardī, kapardaka, etc.
text.7710:
karṣa, name of a weight equal to 80 ratis or about 146
grains;
sometimes regarded 100 ratis or about 183 grains;
sometimes also regarded as 120 ratis in weight;
a coin (cf.
kārṣāpaṇa).
text.7711:
kārṣāpaṇa, silver coin weighing 32 ratis (about 58 grains),
also called purāṇa or dharaṇa; copper coin of 80 ratis or about
146 grains (sometimes 100 ratis or about 183 grains), also
called paṇa; Śaka-type silver coin of about 20 ratis, also called
rūpaka, dramma, etc.;
gold coin of 80 ratis (cf. suvarṇa);
name
applied to gaṇḍa māḍa (probably (1/2) tola in weight), also called
niṣka (q. v.);
same as kāhaṇa, etc.;
cf. karṣa of 120 ratis.
text.7714:
kāśu, Tamil;
spelt in English as cash; name of a copper
coin, (1/100) of a fanam; sometimes called dīnāra; money;
tax;
cf.
kāśu-kaḍamai, ‘tax in coins’;
also Sanskrit karṣa.
text.7715:
kaṭhāri-aṅkuśa-gadyāṇa, probably, ‘a gadyāṇa bearing the
representation of a dagger and a goad’;
see gadyāṇa.
text.7716: kola, same as tola; equal to 2 śāṇas.
text.7718:
komarina-gadyāṇa, same as kumāra-gadyāṇa; name of a tax;
see gadyāṇa.
text.7719:
kovai, Tamil;
name of a gold coin.
text.7721:
kṛṣṇala, same as rati or guñjā (about 1(3/4) grains);
re
garded as equal to 3 ratis by the Kṛtyalalpataru which seems to
confuse rati with yava.
text.7722:
kṛṣṇarāja-rūpaka, ‘rūpaka issued by Kṛṣṇarāja (Kalacuri
Kṛṣṇa, sixth century A. D.)’;
see rūpaka.
text.7723:
kṣudraka, same as draṃkṣaṇa or tola (q. v.);
cf. kṣudrama.
text.7724: kṣudrama, variant of kṣudraka; same as tola (q. v.).
text.7725:
kumāra-gadyāṇaka, name of a tax;
see gadyāṇa; cf. koma-
rina-gadyāṇa and kumara-kaccāṇam.
text.7728:
kulottuṅga-māḍa, ‘māḍa issued by Kulottuṅga (i. e. Col13a
Cālukya Kulottuṅga I, 1070-1120 A. D.)’;
see māḍa.
text.7730: lohaḍiyā, equal to 20 pāvīsās or 100 cowrie-shells.
text.7732:
lokki-gadyāṇa, ‘gadyāṇa minted at Lokki (modern Lak
kundi in the Dharwar District, Mysore State)’;
see gadyāṇa.
text.7733:
māḍa, Telugu;
gold or silver coin, 40 ratis (about 73
grains) in weight;
half of a dīnāra; half of a pagoda, or tenth
of a paṇa (fanam) in value;
same as māḍha, māḍhā, māḍai;
50 per cent;
cf. gaṇḍa-māḍa also called kārṣāpaṇa and gaṇḍa-
niṣka; Tamil modification of Sanskrit māṣa.
text.7734: māḍa-badipātuka, fraction of a māḍa; see māḍa.
text.7736:
māḍha, Oḏiyā;
also spelt māḍhā; same as māḍa, etc.
text.7738:
malla-nandi-māḍa, probably, ‘māḍa bearing the figure of
a wrestler and a bull’, or ‘māḍa minted by Mallanandin’;
see
māḍa.
text.7739:
malla-māḍa, possibly, ‘māḍa bearing the figure of a wrest
ler’, or an abbreviation of malla-nandi-māḍa; see māḍa.
text.7741:
maṇḍa, equal to 5 māṣas (50 ratis);
cf. māḍa.
text.7742:
mañjāḍi, (1/10) of a kaḻañju, (1/100) of a śatamāna; sometimes
regarded as 5(1/2) grains in weight, but may be about 4 grains also.
text.7743:
māppaṇam, same as Sanskrit mahāpaṇa; may be also ‘tax of
one paṇa per mā measure of grains’.
text.7744: marīci, a minute unit of measurement.
text.7745:
māṣa, name of a weight or a coin weighing 5 ratis originally;
later regarded as 10 ratis in weight;
(1/4) of a śāna and (1/8) of a
śatamāna; sometimes regarded as (1/20) of a paṇa of 100 ratis
(i. e. 5 ratis);
a gold coin (as opposed to the silver māṣaka)
according to the Kṛtyakalpataru; cf. ādya-māṣa, māḍa.
text.7746:
māṣaka, same as māṣa; according to the Kṛtyakalpataru,
a silver coin as opposed to the gold māṣa
text.7747: mṛḍa, name of a weight like māñjāḍi (q. v.). Cf. pṛḍa, pruḍ.
text.7748:
mudal-tiramam, mudaṟṟiramam, Tamil;
‘tax payable in
cash’;
cf. tiramam = dramma (q. v.).
text.7752:
nānā, same as nāṇaka; cf. Kuṣāṇa coins bearing the repre
sentation of the West Asian mother-goddess Nana.
text.7757:
niṣka, gold coin or weight equal to one karṣa (80 ratis or
about 146 grains) of 16 māṣas or to 4 or 108 or 150 suvarṇas
(q. v.);
silver coin equal to one śatamāna (320 ratis);
some
times identified with māḍa (q. v.).
text.7758:
obol, Greek coin;
(1/6) of drachma (q. v.).
text.7759:
pāda-viṃśopaka, ‘one-fourth of a viṃśopaka (q. v.)’;
cf. pāvīsā
which is the same as paisā.
text.7760:
padmanidhi-malla-māḍa, probably, ‘maḍa bearing the
figure of a wrestler meant for depositing in a temple treasury’;
but cf. malla-māḍa, etc.;
see māḍa.
text.7762:
pāga, same as Kannaḍa hāga; (1/4) of the standard coin;
probably the same as Sanskrit bhāga.
text.7763:
pagoda, also called ‘star pagoda’;
Anglicised form of the name
of the gold coin called gadyāṇa, hūn (hon) or varāha; since the
word pagoda also meant ‘a temple’, the coin seems to have been
so named owing to the representation of a temple or a deity on
it;
pagoda may be a corruption of bhagavatī meaning ‘the mother
goddess’.
text.7764:
paikamu, Telugu;
supposed to be a small coin equal to
(1/4) or (1/5) of a gadyāṇa (q. v.).
text.7765:
paisā, (1/64) or (1/100) of a rupee; same as pāvīsā = Sanskrit
pāda-viṃśaka (ºviṃśatika or ºviṃśopaka).
text.7766:
pala, weight of 320 ratis (cf. śatamāna);
equal to 4 or 5
suvarṇas according to the Yājñavalkyasmṛti.
text.7767: paḻamudal-ānai-accu, same as palañśalāgai; see accu.
text.7769: paḻañjalāgai-accu, same as palañśalāgai; see accu.
text.7771:
paḻañ-śalāgai, Tamil;
a kind of coin (accu) probably of the
shape of a śalākā. Cf. śrī-yakki-paḻañ-śalāgai.
text.7773:
paṇa, same as the copper kārṣāpaṇa, 80 ratis in weight
according to Manu, etc.;
equal to 80 cowrie-shells according
to the Līlāvatī; regarded in East India during the late medieval
period as equal to 80 cowrie-shells and (1/16) of a kāhaṇ =
kārṣāpaṇa (q. v.);
(1/16) of a suvarṇa according to some;
(1/48) of a
kārṣāpaṇa according to the Kṛtyakalpataru; same as Tamil paṇam
(q. v.)
text.7774:
paṇam, Tamil;
spelt fanam in English;
same as Sans
krit paṇa (q. v.);
but in Tamil, a small gold coin or money
in general;
cf. paṇa-vargam, ‘taxes in cash’, also called kāś-
āya-vargam (literally, ‘taxes payable in kāśu, i. e. cash or money’).
text.7775:
paṇa-purāṇa, ‘purāṇa (q. v.) counted in paṇas (q. v.)’;
cf.
kapardaka-purāṇa and kapardaka-voḍi.
text.7776:
paṇa-vāśi, Tamil;
‘discount for the exchange of coins’;
see paṇam.
text.7778:
pañciyaka-drama, probably, ‘dramma minted by the pañca or
pañcakula i. e. the Pañcāyat Board’;
or ‘dramma equal to five
copper coins’;
see dramma.
text.7781:
partāb, name of a gold coin;
a half pagoda (q. v.).
text.7783:
pāruttha, a silver coin equal to 8 drammas of copper or
billon;
cf. poruttha-dramma.
text.7785:
pāvīsā, (1/20) of a lohaḍiyā; same as Sanskrit pāda-viṃśaka
(ºviṃśatika or ºviṃśopaka) and modern paisā (q. v.).
text.7786:
phadiyā, same as phadyaka; a copper coin about two annas
in value.
text.7790:
pon, also spelt poṉ in Tamil;
same as hon (i. e. hūn or
varāha);
same as ‘gold’ māḍai, gadyāṇa, etc.;
money. Cf.
Tamil pon-bhaṇḍāram, pon-paṇḍāra-vāśal; also pon-vargam, pon-
vari, etc., meaning ‘taxes payable in gold or coins’.
text.7792:
pon-gadyāṇa, ‘gold gadyāṇa’;
same as gadyāṇa-ponnu; see gadyāṇa.
text.7795: pṛḍa, a variant of mṛḍa (q. v.). Cf. pruḍ.
text.7796:
priyaśrāha-gajamalla-gadyāṇa, probably, gadyāṇa minted by
Priyaśrāha and Gajamalla (or Gajamalla of Priyaśrāha);
see
gadyāṇa.
text.7797: pruḍ, a variant of mṛḍa (q. v.). Cf. pṛḍa.
text.7799:
‘punch-marked’, name applied to old Indian coins of
copper and silver, on which the symbols were punched by
different punches as was not the case with the die-struck and
cast coins. Similar coins were sometimes cast from dies also.
text.7800:
purāṇa, a silver coin also called dharaṇa and kārṣāpaṇa, 32
ratis (about 58 grains) in weight;
name applied to the silver
punch-marked coins and also to the Śaka-type silver coins
weighing about 20 ratis.
text.7801:
rājarāja-māḍa, Telugu;
‘māḍa or māḍai issued by king
Rājarāja (Col13a Rājarāja I, 985-1016 A. D.)’;
see māḍa.
text.7803:
rajendraco l13a-māḍa, ‘māḍa issued by king Rājendra-col13a
(Rājendra I, 1016-43 A.D.)’;
see māḍa.
text.7804: raktikā, modern rati; a little above 1(3/4) grains.
text.7807: rati, same as raktikā; a little above 1(3/4) grains.
text.7808:
raupya-ṭaṅka, ‘a silver ṭaṅka (q. v.)’;
a silver kārṣāpaṇa so
called in South India according to Nārada.
text.7809:
rekai-ppon, regarded as the name of a gold coin of the
Vijayanagara times so called probably for bearing linear marks
(rekhā);
may be ‘revenue income in cash’.
text.7811:
rudradāmaka, ‘kārṣāpaṇa issued by Rudradāman’;
name
applied to the silver coins issued by the Śaka rulers of Western
India;
its later imitations were called rūpaka, dramma, etc.
text.7812: rūpa, same as rūpaka or rūpyaka (q. v.).
text.7813:
rūpaka, silver coin;
silver coin (1/16) (about 20 ratis) of a
gold dīnāra, etc.;
also called dramma, purāṇa, kārṣāpaṇa, etc.;
same as modern rupee; cf. kṛṣṇarāja-rūpaka.
text.7814:
rupee, English form of rūpīya (q. v.);
silver coin equal to
16 annas and 64 paisās.
text.7815:
rūpīya (rūpīah), Muhammadan name of rūpya, rūpaka or
rūpyaka (q. v.);
same as modern rupee.
text.7816:
rūpya, same as rūpaka or rūpyaka (q. v.);
same as modern
rupee.
text.7817: śāhaṇikāṭi, supposed to be the name of a coin.
text.7818:
śalāgai, Tamil;
name of a coin also called paḻañśalāgai
(accu); probably had the shape of a śalākā.
text.7821:
śāṇa, name of a weight or a coin 40 ratis in weight;
equal
to 4 māṣas; sometimes regarded as 32 ratis and called niṣka and
ṭaṅka; rarely also regarded as equal to 24 or 20 ratis.
text.7824:
sarṣapa, sometimes called ‘red sarṣapa’;
a small unit of
measurement.
text.7825: śāśukāni, also called śāśukāni-ṭaṅka; same as ŞaŞghānī.
text.7826:
śāśukāni-ṭaṅka, same as śāśukāni or ŞaŞghāṇī.
ŞaŞghānī, Tughluk coin, 4 jītals in weight and value.
text.7827:
śatamāna, the weight of 320 ratis; literally, ‘a hundred
units of measurement’, the unit probably being the mañjāḍi (q. v.);
also called pala and niṣka (320 ratis of gold or silver);
during the medieval period, sometimes regarded as 160 ratis;
name sometimes applied to an ancient gold coin.
text.7828:
satera, also spelt sateraka; probably the same as Greek
stater; regarded as equal to 2 dīnāras.
text.7832:
siglos, name of the silver coin (86.45 grains) of ancient
Irān.
text.7834:
ṣoḍaśī, also called ṣoḍaśikā; probably, one-sixteenth of
the standard silver coin in weight or value;
cf. paṇa.
text.7836:
śo l13iya-kkāśu, ‘the Col13a kāśu (copper coin)’;
see kāśu.
text.7837:
śreṣṭhi-jīrṇa-viśvamalla-priya, probably a mistake for jīrṇa-
śreṣṭhi-viśvamalla-priya, ‘old coin minted by Śreṣṭhin Viśvamalla’.
text.7838:
śrīmad-ādivarāha-dramma, ‘dramma issued by śrīmad-Ādivarāha’;
cf. ādivarāha-dramma; see dramma.
text.7840:
stater, Greek silver and gold coin;
silver stater was
also called tetradrachma; gold stater had the same weight as Persian
double daric (265 grains).
text.7842:
surabhi-māḍa, probably, ‘māḍa bearing the figure of a
cow’;
see māḍa.
text.7843:
suvarṇa, weight of 16 māṣas or 80 ratis (about 146 grains);
16 kārṣāpaṇas or rūpakas or 48 paṇas according to different
authorities;
called picu, pāṇi, kroḍa, binduka, viḍālapadaka,
haṃsapada, grāsagraha and tola; also called niṣka; (1/4) of pala; gold
coin weighing 80 ratis; name applied to Tamil kal13añju (about
32 ratis or 58 grains theoretically).
text.7845:
ṭākā, modern Bengali form of ṭaṇkā (from ṭaṅkaka);
silver
coin;
money;
written in old Bengali as taṅkā; see ṭaṅka.
text.7848: tāṅk, also called tāṅkī; same as ṭanka.
text.7849:
ṭaṅka, a coin in general;
a silver coin (often one tola in
weight);
same as śāna; equal to 4 silver fanams, silver coin
of the Delhi Suḻtāns, 96 or 100 ratis in weight;
same as aṭha-
gānī (q. v.);
a small copper coin;
(1/2) of a rupee. There were
gold and copper taṅkas; see hema-ṭaṅka and raupya-ṭaṅka. Cf.
ṭāṅk, etc.
text.7850:
ṭaṅkaka, same as ṭaṅka (q. v.);
name of a silver coin;
some
times mentioned as bearing the figure of the Bhagavat.
text.7852: tār, name of a silver coin, equal to (1/6) of a gold fanam.
text.7855:
tola, also spelt tolaka; 80 ratis in weight;
same as suvarṇa.
text.7856: tolaka, same as kola or tola; 80 ratis in weight.
text.7857:
triśūla-kāśu, probably, ‘kāśu bearing the representation
of a trident’;
possibly issued by the authorities of a Śiva temple;
see kāśu.
text.7858:
tuḻai-ppon, Tamil;
‘correct weight’ or ‘good current coin’.
text.7859: turai-mi ṉṉar-pon, a kind of pon (i. e. hon, gadyāṇa or varāha).
text.7861:
uppu-kkāśu, ‘salt money’;
name of a tax;
see kāśu.
text.7864:
uttama-gaṇḍa-māḍa, probably ‘good (i. e. new) gaṇḍamāḍa’
or ‘gaṇḍa-māḍa issued by king Uttama (i. e. Uttama-col13a,
980-85 A. D.);
see māḍa.
text.7865:
vagainda-kāśu, name of a tax;
see kāśu.
text.7866: val, sometimes regarded as (1/20) of a gadyāṇa.
text.7868:
vaḻāl-va l13i-tiṟantāṉ-guḻikai, Pāṇḍya coin supposed to be
issued by Jaṭāvarman Sundara-pāṇḍya I;
see gulikā, etc.
text.7870:
varāha, a gold coin;
same as hūn or hon (q. v.);
also called
pagoda (q. v.) or ‘star pagoda’.
text.7871:
varāha-gadyāṇa, same as varāha (q. v.), gadyāṇa or pagoda
(q. v.).
text.7872: varāha-paṇam, probably ‘money calculated in varāha (q. v.).’
text.7873: varāha-viṃśopaka, (1/20) of a varāha; see varāha and viṃśopaka.
text.7874: varāhan-puḻḻi-kuḻigai, see varāha and gulikā, etc.
text.7875: varāṭakā, same as varāṭaka or varāṭikā.
text.7876:
varāṭikā, cowrie-shell used as a coin;
money.
text.7877:
vāśal-paṇam, ‘door-tax’;
periodical payment due to the
palace;
same as vāśal-tiramam; see paṇa.
text.7879: vaṭaka, same as draṃkṣaṇa or tola.
text.7881:
veli-kkāśu, same as veli-ppayaṟu; name of a tax;
see kāśu.
text.7884:
vigraha-dramma, ‘dramma issued or minted by Vigraha’;
same as vigrahapāla-dramma, etc.;
see dramma.
text.7885:
vigraha-dramma-visvovaka, ‘(1/20) of the vigraha-dramma’;
see
dramma and viṃśopaka.
text.7886:
vigrahapāla-dramma, ‘dramma issued or minted by Vigraha
pāla’;
same as vigraha-dramma (q. v.), etc.;
see dramma.
text.7887:
vigrahapāla-satka-dramma, same as vigrahapāla-dramma (q. v.),
etc.;
see dramma.
text.7888:
vigrahapālīya-dramma, ‘dramma issued or minted by Vigra
hapāla’;
same as vigraha-dramma (q. v.), etc.
text.7889:
vigrahatuṅgīya-dramma, ‘dramma issued or minted by
Vigrahatuṅga’;
cf. vigraha-dramma, etc.;
see dramma.
text.7891:
vil-paṇam, ‘sales tax’, or ‘tax on bows or archery’;
see
paṇa.
text.7892: viṃśatika, regarded as equal to 20 māṣas; cf. viṃśopaka.
text.7894:
viṃśopaka, (1/20) of the standard silver coin of about 20 ratis;
same as visvovaka, visopaka, vīsovā, etc.
text.7895:
vīracampan-guḻigai, gulikā of the Śambhuvarāya king
Vīracampa;
see gulikā, etc.
text.7897:
vīsala-priya-dramma, also called vīsala-prī-dramma; cf. jīrṇa-
viśvamalla-priya, Vīsala being the same as Viśvamalla.
text.7901:
voḍī, also called voḍikā and voḍrī; sometimes regarded as a
cowrie-shell used as coin;
but really, the unit equal to 5 gaṇḍās
= 20 cowries. Cf. buḏī, kapardaka-voḍī (q. v.).
text.7902: voḍikā, same as voḍī. Cf. buḏī and kapardaka-voḍī (q. v.).
text.7904:
vṛṣa-viṃśopaka, ‘a viṃśopaka bearing the figure of a bull’;
see viṃśopaka.
text.7906:
yakki-accu, ‘accu bearing the figure of a Yakṣī (a village
goddess)’;
see accu.
